required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pressure Support Ventilation During Laparoscopic and Abdominal Robotic Surgery.
clinical_study.official_title: Pressure Support Ventilation During Laparoscopic and Abdominal Robotic Surgery.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a single-center, blind, prospective, randomized, controlled trial of pressure support ventilation (PSVpro) versus pressure control ventilation - volume guaranteed (PCV - VG) during laparoscopic and robotic abdominal surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
The objective of the study to evaluate the possibility and feasibility of using PSVpro during anesthesia during long-term laparoscopic and robot-assisted abdominal operations at different levels of neuromuscular block.
Intervention: We plan to include 100 patients who will undergo elective long (more 2 hours) laparoscopic or abdominal robotic surgery. All patients will be randomly assigned in two groups in ratio 1:1. 1 group- deep neuromuscular block and mandatory ventilation; 2 group- partial neuromuscular block and pressure support ventilation.
Expected Results. PSV may reduce the systemic inflammatory response compared to the mandatory ventilation during laparoscopic and abdominal robotic surgery.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: t is planned to recruit patients in two groups: group 1-patients who will undergo General anesthesia with deep neuromuscular block and PCV-VG; group 2-patients with partial neuromuscular block and PSVpro. Randomization of patients into two 1:1 groups will be performed by random number generation.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of biomarkers of lung injury
primary_outcome.description: Measure concentration of Interleukin-6 (IL-6), Interleukin-8 (IL-8), tumor necrosis factor receptor I / II (sTNF rI / II)) in blood serum

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum intraoperative lactate level in the early postoperative period
The maximum level of vasopressor support during surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of skin incision to time of skin closure assessed up to 24 hours

other_outcome.time_frame: Period of time from induction to volatile anesthetic supply stop assessed up to 24 hours
Period of time from intubation to extubation assessed up to 24 hours

other_outcome.measure: Length of stay (LOS) in the intensive care unit (ICU).
other_outcome.time_frame: Period of time from ICU arrival to discharge from ICU assessed up to 1 year
other_outcome.description: Length of stay (LOS) in the intensive care unit (ICU).

other_outcome.measure: Time to reach an Aldrete score > 9 points after anaesthesia
other_outcome.time_frame: Period of time from volatile anesthetic suplly stop to time when patient has more than 9 points according Aldrete score assessed up to 24 hours
other_outcome.description: Time to reach an Aldrete score > 9 points after anaesthesia

other_outcome.time_frame: Since skin incision to skin closure assessed up to 24 hours
Since skin incision to skin closure assessed up to 24 hours

other_outcome.measure: Supplemental oxygen in the early postoperative period
other_outcome.time_frame: Since extubation up to 24 hours after extubation

other_outcome.description: The QoR-40 incorporates five dimensions of health: patient support, comfort, emotions, physical independence, and pain; each item is graded on a five-point Likert scale. QoR-40 scores range from 40 (extremely poor quality of recovery) to 200 (excellent quality of recovery).

other_outcome.measure: Changes of spirometry parameter FVC after surgery
other_outcome.description: FVC before surgery (L) - FVC after surgery (L)

other_outcome.measure: Changes of spirometry parameter FEV1 after surgery
other_outcome.description: FEV1 before surgery (L)- FEV1 after surgery (L)

other_outcome.measure: Changes of spirometry parameter FEV1/FVC after surgery
other_outcome.description: FEV1/FVC before surgery (percentage %) - FEV1/FVC after surgery (percentage %)

other_outcome.measure: Changes of spirometry parameter PEF after surgery
other_outcome.description: PEF before surgery (L/s) - PEF after surgery (L/s)

other_outcome.measure: Changes of spirometry parameter VC after surgery
other_outcome.description: VC before surgery (L) - VC after surgery (L)

other_outcome.measure: Changes of spirometry parameter FEV1/VC after surgery
other_outcome.description: FEV1/VC before surgery (percentage %) - FEV1/VC after surgery (percentage %)

other_outcome.measure: Volume of atelectasis of lungs after surgery
other_outcome.description: Volume of the lungs measure according to CT lung The volume of atelectasis is the difference in volumes of lungs before and after surgery

other_outcome.measure: The level of pain assess after surgery by Numeric Rating Scale (NRS)
The level of pain assess after surgery by Numeric Rating Scale (NRS)
The level of pain assess after surgery by Numeric Rating Scale (NRS)

arm_group.description: deep neuromuscular block and mandatory ventilation (PCV-VG);
partial neuromuscular block and pressure support ventilation (PSVpro).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Written consent.
- Men and women aged 18 years or more.
- The physical status from ASA classification I, II or III.
- BMI <= 34.9 kg / m2.
- Low risk of respiratory complications.
- Laparoscopic surgery in the pelvis.
Exclusion criteria:
- The physical status from ASA IV or V.
- BMI> = 35 kg / m2.
- Neuromuscular disease.
- Allergy to Anesthetic Agents.
- Operations on two cavities.
- Operations on the chest cavity.
